abstract.p: Marilyn A Brown letter explains that report Scenarios for a Clean Future, which she co-wrote, is assessment of potential for energy-efficient and clean-energy technologies to play greater role in meeting US energy needs (S)

block.p: Re ''U.S. Scientists See Big Power Savings From Conservation'' (front page, May 6):
Re ''U.S. Scientists See Big Power Savings From Conservation'' (front page, May 6):
As one of the primary authors of the report ''Scenarios for a Clean Future,'' I would like to clarify the scope of the study and its conclusions.

The report is not a prediction of future energy needs, nor does it make policy recommendations. It is an assessment of the potential for energy-efficient and clean-energy technologies to play a greater role in meeting the country's energy challenges. It examines alternative energy policy and technology futures under scenarios of increased public concern for the environment.

Limitations of the report include the timeliness of its data and assumptions about energy policies that have not been carried out. The report's three energy scenarios together make a compelling case that advances in energy technologies could substantially improve America's energy future.
MARILYN A. BROWN Oak Ridge, Tenn., May 8, 2001
The writer is director, Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Program, Oak Ridge Natl. Laboratory.
